summary: It's clear that you find smoking relaxing and that you don't like the smell, but you also recognize the negative effects it has on your health and want to make a change. You understand that you will need to use your willpower to make this change and that this will result in a healthier you. It sounds like you have a clear goal in mind and the motivation to make it happen. Is there anything else you want to add that might help you achieve your goal?

Summarizing our conversation so far, you expressed that you enjoy the feeling of relaxation from smoking and dislike the smell. You also expressed that, while you don't want to make a change, you recognize that it will require discipline and persistence to do so. You have identified that you may need to find ways to stay busy in order to reduce the amount you smoke. Is there anything else that you would like to add before we move on?

It sounds like you are aware of the health risks associated with smoking and are motivated to make a change in your smoking habits. You want to stop smoking altogether or reduce the amount you smoke when you’re with friends. To make this change, you’ve identified the need for nicotine replacement therapy (NRT). Is there anything else you feel you need to do to make this change?

It sounds like you have a clear understanding of the ways in which smoking is causing harm to you and you want to find a way to stop smoking altogether. You have expressed that you need a replacement for your current smoking habit and are looking for steps to take to make this change. It's great that you have identified the need for change and I understand that it can be a difficult process. Can you tell me why it is important for you to make this change?

It sounds like you enjoy the flavor of tobacco and use it to help you relax. You are also aware of the health risks associated with smoking, and want to make a change to reduce the number of cigarettes you smoke. This change is important to you because you believe it will improve your health and odor. You understand that making this change will require discipline. Is there anything else you would like to add when it comes to your goal of reducing the number of cigarettes you smoke?

Thank you for sharing your experiences and feelings about smoking with me. You enjoy the taste of tobacco and are looking for ways to relax, but you are also concerned about the health effects of smoking. Your goal is to reduce the number of cigarettes you smoke, so that you can improve your health and smell. You understand that this requires discipline, and you are prepared to take the necessary steps to make this change. Is there anything else you would like to add?

It sounds like you understand that combining smoking and cannabis is something that you enjoy, but you are also aware of the health implications of smoking and the importance of reducing your habit. You have a goal of decreasing the amount of cigarettes you smoke daily, in order to improve your physical health. This is a positive step towards quitting smoking and I'm glad to hear that you are taking it seriously. Is there anything else you want to add that I might have missed in our conversation?

Thank you for sharing with me your feelings and experiences with smoking. I understand that you enjoy it for the relaxation and short breaks, but that you also feel addicted to it and want to reduce your number of cigarettes smoked per day. You want to make this change so that you will be smoking less and have identified the steps you need to take to do that. Is there anything else you would like to add before we move forward?

It sounds like you’re really considering making changes to your smoking habit. You find it enjoyable and like the feeling it gives you, but you also don’t like the addictive and unhealthy aspects of smoking. You want to reduce the number of cigarettes you smoke each day and, by making this change, you believe it will have a positive impact on your life. You also recognize that you will need to create a plan and stick to it in order to make this change. It sounds like you’re motivated to make a change and you’re aware of what needs to be done - that’s a great start! Is there anything else you would like to add that we haven’t discussed yet?

It sounds like you are aware of the benefits of smoking, such as it filling time and helping you cope with stressful situations, but also the negative health effects. You have identified the goal of wanting to quit smoking completely and have acknowledged that it is a long process that requires effort. You are thinking about ways to reduce your smoking habit, such as not smoking on nights out. Is there anything else you would like to add to this conversation?

It sounds like you're aware of the feelings of joy that you get when smoking and that you don't like the smell of cigarettes on your clothes. You want to make a change to your smoking habit that will bring you happiness, and you have identified the steps that you need to take to reduce your consumption. It's clear that you are motivated to make this change and that you understand the steps that you need to take. Is there anything else that you think would be important to focus on as you make this change?

It sounds like you feel that smoking punctuates your day and gives you something to focus on while you work. Also, you think that smoking makes you feel more tired than you would otherwise, which can have a negative effect on your daily activities. Although you don't currently want to make any changes to your smoking habit, you recognize that quitting smoking would mean feeling less tired and having more energy. Is there anything else you'd like to add about why you would consider quitting smoking?

Yes, that makes sense. It sounds like you want to make a conscious effort to go out with friends who don't smoke and make yourself not smoke when you are with friends who do. You want to become more comfortable with not smoking when in social situations and increase your confidence in this area. Is that correct?

Thank you for sharing your experience with me. It sounds like you understand the reasons why you smoke and the aspects of smoking that you do not like. You want to make a change in your smoking habit by smoking less, and you know that you need to be motivated to do this. Is there anything else that you would like to tell me about your smoking habit that I might have missed?

Yes, that makes sense. It's great that you recognize that quitting smoking will help you save money in the long-term. Our conversation has been very helpful in understanding your motivations for wanting to make a change in your smoking habit. You want to quit because you want to save money, and you think that calculating the yearly cost of smoking may shock you into quitting. Is there anything else that you would like to add that we haven't discussed yet?

It sounds like you want to make a change in your smoking habit, by cutting down on smoking and eventually quitting completely. You understand that this change will help you become healthier and reduce your cravings for cigarettes. It's great that you have identified the steps you need to take to make this change. Is there anything else you would like to add about why you want to make this change?

It sounds like you're feeling a lot of ambivalence about smoking. You enjoy the feeling of inhaling and letting it go, but you also don't like the amount of money you're spending on cigarettes. You want to make a change and reduce the number of cigarettes you smoke from 10 to 5 per day. You believe that if you do this, the appearance of your health will improve. You want to make this change and you have the willpower and desire to achieve it. Is there anything else you'd like to add about your experience with smoking and your goals for changing?

Overall, it sounds like you are wanting to make a change in your smoking habit. You don't like the expense of cigarettes, or the way they make you smell, and you would like to reduce the amount of cigarettes you smoke each day, or even stop smoking and switch to vaping. You aren't sure how much better you will feel after making this change, but you understand that reducing the amount of cigarettes you smoke will help you quit for good. Is there anything else that you think is important to mention in order to make this change?

It sounds like you enjoy the social aspect of smoking, but don't like the bitter taste it leaves in your mouth. You want to reduce your smoking when you are drinking alcohol, in order to reduce any negative effects it has on your health. You understand that making changes will require self-control, which you are willing to work on. Is there anything else you'd like to add that I haven't mentioned?

Thank you for sharing your thoughts and feelings about smoking with me. I understand that you enjoy the feeling of relaxation after smoking, but dislike the smell. You want to quit smoking and believe that by doing so, you will feel better physically and mentally. Your plan to make this change is to gradually reduce the amount you smoke. Is there anything else you would like to add about your experience with smoking or your plan to change?
